intro: Mariscus fallax var. major, commonly known as the giant mariscus, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length, with a distinctive fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
